title: 103_hr653
content: The Watermelon Research and Promotion Improvement Act of 1993 includes changes to referendum procedures, expansion of watermelon plans nationwide, clarification of producer and handler differences, collection of assessments by the board, changes to assessment rates, elimination of assessment refunds, equitable treatment of watermelon plans, and separate consideration of plan amendments. SEC. 2 amends the Watermelon Research and Promotion Act to require majority approval for a plan to take effect. SEC. 3 expands watermelon plans nationwide. SEC. 3 expands watermelon plans nationwide to include all states and the District of Columbia. SEC. 4 clarifies differences between producers and handlers. SEC. 4 amends the Watermelon Research and Promotion Act to clarify that producers purchasing watermelons from other producers in a significant volume can only serve on the Board as representatives of handlers. SEC. 5 amends the Act to change the language regarding the collection of assessments by the Board to the payment of assessments to the Board. SEC. 6 amends the Watermelon Research and Promotion Act to require the Secretary to follow notice and comment procedures when fixing or changing assessment rates, excluding certain procedures. SEC. 7 eliminates watermelon assessment refunds. SEC. 7 amends the Watermelon Research and Promotion Act to eliminate watermelon assessment refunds if approved in a referendum. The Watermelon Research and Promotion Act is amended to include definitions for "importer" and "plan," and to allow importers to be included in the issuance of plans under the Act. SEPARATE CONSIDERATION OF WATERMELON PLAN AMENDMENTS. Section 1655 of the Watermelon Research and Promotion Act is amended to require separate voting on amendments to the plan related to the elimination of assessment refunds before any changes can be made by the Secretary. The Watermelon Research and Promotion Act is amended to require separate voting on plan amendments regarding assessment refunds and subjecting importers to plan terms and conditions. Eligible voters in the referendum include producers, handlers, and importers affected by the plan amendments.
